text.p: The exact date for shutting RTZ-CRA's Kennecott Utah Copper smelter to install a new anode casting wheel is still unknown, but was due soon as replacement components arrive at the site this weekend, Kennecott spokesman Louie Cononelos said.
The blister-producing smelter is set to close for 42 days, but the flash smelting furnace will continue to operate for most of the shutdown period to produce copper matte, Cononelos said.
The refinery will continue to produce cathode using the anode in process, but Cononelos declined to say how much refined copper production would be lost.
In February, RTZ-CRA said its glitch-hit $850 million new 270,000-tonne-per-year smelter was expected to be fully operation by about June following April's shutdown.
Problems at the smelter cost the company $150 million in lost profits after a delay of more than a year to reach full output.
